definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
thicket/tedious
to eradicate/to extinguish
firefighting/to extinguish a fire and save life and property/to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
poker (game) (loanword)/playing cards
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
impossible to unravel/confusing
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
poker (card game)/playing card/CL:副[fu4]
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
to fall down
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
sumo wrestling/also pr. [xiang4 pu1]
(onom.) thud/flutter/flop
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to swat/(of wings) to flap
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles

sentences.english: Clean up any beads of mercury by using an index card and plastic dustpan.
sentences.chinese: 用撲索引卡和塑料簸箕清理水銀珠子。

sentences.english: The nearest leaps at his throat.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一隻撲向他的喉嚨。

sentences.english: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west;
sentences.chinese: 他們要向西飛，撲在非利士人的肩頭上。

sentences.english: To let us go first, the goat pounces on the wolves strongly.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓我們先走，大山羊不顧死活地朝狼羣撲了過去。

sentences.english: He took a breath to clear away the cobwebs of the night as the raven flapped away.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了口氣吹走昨夜的蜘蛛網，烏鴉隨之撲翅飛開。

sentences.english: The crows dived on the owl .
The cat flew at the dog that threatened it.
sentences.chinese: 貓見到狗威脅它，便突然向狗撲去。

sentences.english: Gently the willow fluff wafts to the embroidered screen.
sentences.chinese: 遊絲軟系飄春榭，落絮輕沾撲繡簾。

sentences.english: There was clearly nothing left to do but flop down on the shabby little couch and howl.
sentences.chinese: 除了撲到破舊的小沙發裏嚎哭顯然別無他法。

sentences.english: The panther pounced on the little rabbit, but muxxed it.
sentences.chinese: 黑豹朝小免子猛撲去，不過沒撲着。

sentences.english: The happy little dog jumped all over him in his joy.
sentences.chinese: 小狗歡快的撲到他身上。

sentences.english: The crazed man went at the policeman with a knife.
sentences.chinese: 那個瘋子拿着刀向警察撲過去。

sentences.english: Remained calm when Reina saved his spot-kick.
sentences.chinese: 在雷納撲出點球時保持了鎮定。

sentences.english: Red Jacket lay sprawled on the cobbles one hundred feet below.
sentences.chinese: 紅夾克四肢伸展，撲躺在三十多米底下的卵石街上。

sentences.english: Do not ask next two ears, one in the head-on embroidery.
sentences.chinese: 兩耳不問身旁事，一心撲在繡品上。

sentences.english: I was eating a sandwich scarred, you want some?
sentences.chinese: 我在喫撲撲三明治，你想要一點嗎？

definition: to float
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
immediately/suddenly
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
concentrated/dense/strong (smell etc)
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
stalwart/sturdy/strong/powerful
strength/energy/enthusiasm/spirit/mood/expression/interest/CL:把[ba3]/Taiwan pr. [jing4]
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
to sprinkle/to spray/to spill/to shed
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
dizzy/halo/ring around moon or sun
